{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Cisco |model=WAP551 |revision=AK9 |upc=882658485817 |ean= |asin=B00D9Y4MJE |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=12/13/2012 |manuf_country=China |manuf=Delta Networks |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=access point |fcc_id=PD5-WAP551 |ic_id=3970A-WAP551 |pwr_v= |pwr_amp= |pwr_conn=Ethernet (PoE) |pwr_poe=af |cpu1_brand=Cavium |cpu1_model=CN3420 |cpu1_cspeed=600 |cpu1_cores=2 |fla1=32 |fla1_brand= |fla1_model= |ram1=128 |ram1_brand=Nanya |ram1_model=NT5TU32M16DG-AC |ram1_num=2 |expansion_if_types=Mini PCIe |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num=1 |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if=Mini PCIe |wi1_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip1_model=BCM43431 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=abgn |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL |wi1_txchains=3 |wi1_rxchains=3 |wi1_sstreams=3 |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand=Broadcom |eth_chip2_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed=1G |lan_ports=1 |wan_ports= |addl_chips=DualBand 802.11abgn Wireless LAN Front End;Skyworks;SiGe SE2594L;SiGe, SE2594L, 139DX;3; |flags= |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=abgn |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip=192.168.1.245 |default_user=cisco |default_pass=cisco |oui= |oui_eth= }} '''Single-Radio 450Mbps 802.11n Access Point with PoE''' [http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/products/collateral/wireless/small-business-500-series-wireless-access-points/data_sheet_c78-727995.html Product page]
[http://www.cisco.com/en/US/prod/collateral/wireless/ps5678/ps12238/data_sheet_c78-727995.pdf Datasheet] :[[Cisco WAP551]]: Selectable radio band (2.4 or 5 GHz) :[[Cisco WAP561]]: Dual concurrent radios (2.4 and 5 GHz) :Single radio (WAP551) or dual radio (WAP561) OFDM This device is essentially identical to the [[Cisco WAP561]] - it is only missing the second radio module (and the Mini PCIe slot to accommodate it). *The ''Cisco'' logo is silkscreened on the top of the board in the FCC photos. :"2976375903" is silkscreened on the bottom. :"2976387400" is silkscreened on the wireless module. *The wireless module is using three ''Skyworks'' (''SiGe'') SE2594L / 2594L Dual-Band WLAN FEMs. :The wireless module would appear to be using BCM43431... or something else other than BCM4331 with one extra character and the same specs.. The PoE injector used in the FCC filing is a ''PowerDsine'' PD-9001G/AC - an 802.3at midspan. [http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16833420485 On Newegg]
